title: Japanese barbecue restaurant coming to Atlantic Station
title_page: Japanese barbecue restaurant coming to Atlantic Station
text:
Big things are going down at Atlantic Station, food-wise, these days.
On the heels of the news that salad chain Salata will open the first of its 20 planned Georgia locations at the mixed-use development comes the announcement that Japanese concept Gyu-Kaku will open in the former Copeland's Cheesecake Bistro space.
Gyu-Kaku, a chain of approximately 700 Japanese yakiniku restaurants in 11 countries, specializes in Japanese barbecue and shared plates. The menu features a variety of appetizers, soups, vegetables and cooked meats including steak, pork, lamb, duck and chicken, as well as Japanese sake, shochu and beer.
Copeland's closed last month.
